intro: Eriosema rhodesicum var. huambense, commonly known as the Huambo yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Peru. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, hairy stipules, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
